(account/id) pairs."},"batchTransferFrom(address,address,uint256[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Overrides the batch transfer function to call the hooks before and after the transfer"},"burn(address,address,uint256[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Burn Liquidity Book (LB) tokens and withdraw tokens from the pool. This function will burn the tokens directly from the caller"},"collectProtocolFees()":{"notice":"Collect the protocol fees from the pool."},"flashLoan(address,bytes32,bytes)":{"notice":"Flash loan tokens from the pool to a receiver contract and execute a callback function. The receiver contract is expected to return the tokens plus a fee to this contract. The fee is calculated as a percentage of the amount borrowed, and is the same for both tokens."},"forceDecay()":{"notice":"Forces the decay of the volatility reference variables"},"getActiveId()":{"notice":"Returns the active id of the Liquidity Book Pair"},"getBin(uint24)":{"notice":"Returns the reserves of a bin"},"getBinStep()":{"notice":"Returns the bin step of the Liquidity Book Pair"},"getFactory()":{"notice":"Returns the Liquidity Book Factory"},"getIdFromPrice(uint256)":{"notice":"Returns the id corresponding to the given price"},"getLBHooksParameters()":{"notice":"Gets the hooks parameters of the Liquidity Book Pair"},"getNextNonEmptyBin(bool,uint24)":{"notice":"Returns the next non-empty bin"},"getOracleParameters()":{"notice":"Returns the oracle parameters of the Liquidity Book Pair"},"getOracleSampleAt(uint40)":{"notice":"Returns the cumulative values of the Liquidity Book Pair at a given timestamp"},"getPriceFromId(uint24)":{"notice":"Returns the price corresponding to the given id, as a 128.128-binary fixed-point number"},"getProtocolFees()":{"notice":"Returns the protocol fees of the Liquidity Book Pair"},"getReserves()":{"notice":"Returns the reserves of the Liquidity Book Pair This is the sum of the reserves of all bins, minus the protocol fees."},"getStaticFeeParameters()":{"notice":"Returns the static fee parameters of the Liquidity Book Pair"},"getSwapIn(uint128,bool)":{"notice":"Simulates a swap in."},"getSwapOut(uint128,bool)":{"notice":"Simulates a swap out."},"getTokenX()":{"notice":"Returns the token X of the Liquidity Book Pair"},"getTokenY()":{"notice":"Returns the token Y of the Liquidity Book Pair"},"getVariableFeeParameters()":{"notice":"Returns the variable fee parameters of the Liquidity Book Pair"},"increaseOracleLength(uint16)":{"notice":"Increase the length of the oracle used by the pool"},"initialize(uint16,uint16,uint16,uint16,uint24,uint16,uint24,uint24)":{"notice":"Initialize the Liquidity Book Pair fee parameters and active id"},"isApprovedForAll(address,address)":{"notice":"Returns true if `spender` is approved to transfer `owner`'s tokens or if `spender` is the `owner`."},"mint(address,bytes32[],address)":{"notice":"Mint liquidity tokens by depositing tokens into the pool. It will mint Liquidity Book (LB) tokens for each bin where the user adds liquidity. This function will not transfer the tokens from the caller, it is expected that the tokens have already been transferred to this contract through another contract, most likely the router. That is why this function shouldn't be called directly, but through one of the add liquidity functions of a router that will also perform safety checks."},"name()":{"notice":"Returns the name of the token."},"setHooksParameters(bytes32,bytes)":{"notice":"Sets the hooks parameter of the pool"},"setStaticFeeParameters(uint16,uint16,uint16,uint16,uint24,uint16,uint24)":{"notice":"Sets the static fee parameters of the pool"},"swap(bool,address)":{"notice":"Swap tokens iterating over the bins until the entire amount is swapped. Token X will be swapped for token Y if `swapForY` is true, and token Y for token X if `swapForY` is false. This function will not transfer the tokens from the caller, it is expected that the tokens have already been transferred to this contract through another contract, most likely the router. That is why this function shouldn't be called directly, but only through one of the swap functions of a router that will also perform safety checks, such as minimum amounts and slippage. The variable fee is updated throughout the swap, it increases with the number of bins crossed. The oracle is updated at the end of the swap."},"symbol()":{"notice":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply(uint256)":{"notice":"Returns the total supply of token of type `id`. /**"}},"notice":"The Liquidity Book Pair contract is the core contract of the Liquidity Book params.approved: The boolean value to grant or revoke permission.

returns._0: The amount of tokens of type `id` owned by `account`.

returns.batchBalances: The balance for each (account, id) pair.

params.amounts: The amounts of the tokens to transfer
params.ids: The ids of the tokens to transfer

params.amountsToBurn: The amounts of LB tokens to burn for each bin
params.from: The address that will burn the LB tokens
params.ids: The ids of the bins from which to withdraw
params.to: The address that will receive the tokens

returns.amounts: The amounts of token X and token Y received by the user

returns.collectedProtocolFees: The amount of protocol fees collected

constructor.details: Constructor for the Liquidity Book Pair contract that sets the Liquidity Book Factory

params.amounts: The encoded amounts of token X and token Y to flash loan
params.data: Any data that will be passed to the callback function
params.receiver: The contract that will receive the tokens and execute the callback function

forceDecay().details: Can only be called by the factory

getActiveId().details: The active id is the id of the bin that is currently being used for swaps. The price of the active bin is the price of the Liquidity Book Pair and can be calculated as follows: `price = (1 + binStep / 10_000) ^ (activeId - 2^23)`

returns.activeId: The active id of the Liquidity Book Pair

returns.binReserveX: The reserve of token X in the bin
returns.binReserveY: The reserve of token Y in the bin

getBinStep().details: The bin step is the increase in price between two consecutive bins, in basis points. For example, a bin step of 1 means that the price of the next bin is 0.01% higher than the price of the previous bin.

returns._0: binStep The bin step of the Liquidity Book Pair, in 10_000th

getIdFromPrice(uint256).details: The id may be inaccurate due to rounding issues, always trust getPriceFromId rather than getIdFromPrice

params.price: The price of y per x as a 128.128-binary fixed-point number

returns.id: The id of the bin corresponding to this price

returns._0: The hooks parameters of the Liquidity Book Pair

getNextNonEmptyBin(bool,uint24).details: The next non-empty bin is the bin with a higher (if swapForY is true) or lower (if swapForY is false) id that has a non-zero reserve of token X or Y.

params.swapForY: Whether the swap is for token Y (true) or token X (false

returns.nextId: The id of the next non-empty bin

returns.activeSize: The active size of the oracle
returns.firstTimestamp: The first timestamp of the oracle, i.e. the timestamp of the oldest sample
returns.lastUpdated: The last updated timestamp of the oracle
returns.sampleLifetime: The sample lifetime for the oracle

getOracleSampleAt(uint40).details: The cumulative values are the cumulative id, the cumulative volatility and the cumulative bin crossed.

params.lookupTimestamp: The timestamp at which to look up the cumulative values

returns.cumulativeBinCrossed: The cumulative bin crossed of the Liquidity Book Pair at the given timestamp
returns.cumulativeId: The cumulative id of the Liquidity Book Pair at the given timestamp
returns.cumulativeVolatility: The cumulative volatility of the Liquidity Book Pair at the given timestamp

getPriceFromId(uint24).details: This is the trusted source of price information, always trust this rather than getIdFromPrice

returns.price: The price corresponding to this id

returns.protocolFeeX: The protocol fees of token X
returns.protocolFeeY: The protocol fees of token Y

returns.baseFactor: The base factor for the static fee
returns.decayPeriod: The decay period for the static fee
returns.filterPeriod: The filter period for the static fee
returns.maxVolatilityAccumulator: The maximum volatility accumulator for the static fee
returns.protocolShare: The protocol share for the static fee
returns.reductionFactor: The reduction factor for the static fee
returns.variableFeeControl: The variable fee control for the static fee

getSwapIn(uint128,bool).details: If `amountOutLeft` is greater than zero, the swap in is not possible, and the maximum amount that can be swapped from `amountIn` is `amountOut - amountOutLeft`.

params.amountOut: The amount of token X or Y to swap in
params.swapForY: Whether the swap is for token Y (true) or token X (false)

returns.amountIn: The amount of token X or Y that can be swapped in, including the fee
returns.amountOutLeft: The amount of token Y or X that cannot be swapped out

getSwapOut(uint128,bool).details: If `amountInLeft` is greater than zero, the swap out is not possible, and the maximum amount that can be swapped is `amountIn - amountInLeft` for `amountOut`.

params.amountIn: The amount of token X or Y to swap in
params.swapForY: Whether the swap is for token Y (true) or token X (false)

returns.amountInLeft: The amount of token X or Y that cannot be swapped in
returns.amountOut: The amount of token Y or X that can be swapped out

returns.tokenX: The address of the token X

returns.tokenY: The address of the token Y

returns.idReference: The id reference for the variable fee
returns.timeOfLastUpdate: The time of last update for the variable fee
returns.volatilityAccumulator: The volatility accumulator for the variable fee
returns.volatilityReference: The volatility reference for the variable fee

params.newLength: The new length of the oracle

initialize(uint16,uint16,uint16,uint16,u.details: Can only be called by the Liquidity Book Factory

params.activeId: The active id of the Liquidity Book Pair
params.baseFactor: The base factor for the static fee
params.decayPeriod: The decay period for the static fee
params.filterPeriod: The filter period for the static fee
params.maxVolatilityAccumulator: The max volatility accumulator for the static fee
params.protocolShare: The protocol share for the static fee
params.reductionFactor: The reduction factor for the static fee
params.variableFeeControl: The variable fee control for the static fee

returns._0: True if `spender` is approved to transfer `owner`'s tokens.

mint(address,bytes32[],address).details: Any excess amount of token will be sent to the `to` address.

params.liquidityConfigs: The encoded liquidity configurations, each one containing the id of the bin and the percentage of token X and token Y to add to the bin.
params.refundTo: The address that will receive the excess amount of tokens
params.to: The address that will receive the LB tokens

returns.amountsLeft: The amounts of token X and token Y that were not added to the pool and were sent to `to`
returns.amountsReceived: The amounts of token X and token Y received by the pool
returns.liquidityMinted: The amounts of LB tokens minted for each bin

returns._0: tokenName_ The name of the token.

setHooksParameters(bytes32,bytes).details: Can only be called by the factory

params.onHooksSetData: The data to be passed to the onHooksSet function of the hooks contract

setStaticFeeParameters(uint16,uint16,uin.details: Can only be called by the factory

params.baseFactor: The base factor of the static fee
params.decayPeriod: The decay period of the static fee
params.filterPeriod: The filter period of the static fee
params.maxVolatilityAccumulator: The max volatility accumulator of the static fee
params.protocolShare: The protocol share of the static fee
params.reductionFactor: The reduction factor of the static fee
params.variableFeeControl: The variable fee control of the static fee

params.swapForY: Whether you're swapping token X for token Y (true) or token Y for token X (false)
params.to: The address to send the tokens to

returns.amountsOut: The encoded amounts of token X and token Y sent to `to`

returns._0: tokenSymbol_ The symbol of the token.

totalSupply(uint256).details: This is the amount of token of type `id` minted minus the amount burned.

returns._0: The total supply of that token id.

approveForAll(address,bool).notice: Grants or revokes permission to `spender` to transfer the caller's lbTokens, according to `approved`.

balanceOf(address,uint256).notice: Returns the amount of tokens of type `id` owned by `account`.

balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).notice: Return the balance of multiple (account/id) pairs.

batchTransferFrom(address,address,uint25.notice: Overrides the batch transfer function to call the hooks before and after the transfer

burn(address,address,uint256[],uint256[].notice: Burn Liquidity Book (LB) tokens and withdraw tokens from the pool. This function will burn the tokens directly from the caller

collectProtocolFees().notice: Collect the protocol fees from the pool.

flashLoan(address,bytes32,bytes).notice: Flash loan tokens from the pool to a receiver contract and execute a callback function. The receiver contract is expected to return the tokens plus a fee to this contract. The fee is calculated as a percentage of the amount borrowed, and is the same for both tokens.

forceDecay().notice: Forces the decay of the volatility reference variables

getActiveId().notice: Returns the active id of the Liquidity Book Pair

getBin(uint24).notice: Returns the reserves of a bin

getBinStep().notice: Returns the bin step of the Liquidity Book Pair

getIdFromPrice(uint256).notice: Returns the id corresponding to the given price

getLBHooksParameters().notice: Gets the hooks parameters of the Liquidity Book Pair

getOracleParameters().notice: Returns the oracle parameters of the Liquidity Book Pair

getOracleSampleAt(uint40).notice: Returns the cumulative values of the Liquidity Book Pair at a given timestamp

getPriceFromId(uint24).notice: Returns the price corresponding to the given id, as a 128.128-binary fixed-point number

getProtocolFees().notice: Returns the protocol fees of the Liquidity Book Pair

getReserves().notice: Returns the reserves of the Liquidity Book Pair This is the sum of the reserves of all bins, minus the protocol fees.

getStaticFeeParameters().notice: Returns the static fee parameters of the Liquidity Book Pair

getTokenX().notice: Returns the token X of the Liquidity Book Pair

getTokenY().notice: Returns the token Y of the Liquidity Book Pair

getVariableFeeParameters().notice: Returns the variable fee parameters of the Liquidity Book Pair

increaseOracleLength(uint16).notice: Increase the length of the oracle used by the pool

initialize(uint16,uint16,uint16,uint16,u.notice: Initialize the Liquidity Book Pair fee parameters and active id

isApprovedForAll(address,address).notice: Returns true if `spender` is approved to transfer `owner`'s tokens or if `spender` is the `owner`.

mint(address,bytes32[],address).notice: Mint liquidity tokens by depositing tokens into the pool. It will mint Liquidity Book (LB) tokens for each bin where the user adds liquidity. This function will not transfer the tokens from the caller, it is expected that the tokens have already been transferred to this contract through another contract, most likely the router. That is why this function shouldn't be called directly, but through one of the add liquidity functions of a router that will also perform safety checks.

name().notice: Returns the name of the token.

setHooksParameters(bytes32,bytes).notice: Sets the hooks parameter of the pool

setStaticFeeParameters(uint16,uint16,uin.notice: Sets the static fee parameters of the pool

swap(bool,address).notice: Swap tokens iterating over the bins until the entire amount is swapped. Token X will be swapped for token Y if `swapForY` is true, and token Y for token X if `swapForY` is false. This function will not transfer the tokens from the caller, it is expected that the tokens have already been transferred to this contract through another contract, most likely the router. That is why this function shouldn't be called directly, but only through one of the swap functions of a router that will also perform safety checks, such as minimum amounts and slippage. The variable fee is updated throughout the swap, it increases with the number of bins crossed. The oracle is updated at the end of the swap.

symbol().notice: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalSupply(uint256).notice: Returns the total supply of token of type `id`. /**
